name: Failed!
prompt: List inspections and their amount of questions, create a column for amount of answered and one for unanswered
query:
SELECT i.id AS inspection_id,
        COUNT(iq.id) AS total_questions,
        SUM(CASE WHEN iqa.id IS NOT NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS answered_questions,
        COUNT(iq.id) - SUM(CASE WHEN iqa.id IS NOT NULL THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS unanswered_questions
FROM inspection i
LEFT JOIN inspectionQuestionAnswer iqa ON i.id = iqa.inspectionId
LEFT JOIN inspectionQuestion iq ON iqa.inspectionQuestionId = iq.id
GROUP BY i.id;

name: Payroll v1
prompt:
create a report that will contains all WorkTimes per user and date of the work times, so group all user work times per date, add a column to show the work order number where those Times where added, and for the date display the weekday (for example mm/dd/yyyy ddd), and for the user show name and last name in the same column called Employee Name
Then show column for Regular Time, for OverTime and Double Time, but the data in those columns needs to be calculated the following way, sum all work time hours for the day and: 
- all hours, with a date on a Sunday, will be Double Time 
- all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, under or equal 8 hours would be Regular Time 
- all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, over 8 hours would be OverTime
query: SELECT CONCAT(COALESCE(se.firstName, ''), ' ', COALESCE(se.lastName, '')) AS `Employee Name`, cwd.date AS `Date`, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT sw.workOrderNumber ORDER BY sw.workOrderNumber SEPARATOR ', ') AS `Work Order Number`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN 0 ELSE LEAST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)), 8) END AS `Regular Time`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN 0 ELSE GREATEST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) - 8, 0) END AS `OverTime`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) ELSE 0 END AS `Double Time`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) ELSE LEAST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)), 8) + GREATEST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) - 8, 0) END AS `Total Time` FROM workTime wt JOIN secure_employee se ON se.id = wt.employeeId AND se.isInternal = 0 LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id = wt.crewWorkDayId LEFT JOIN crew c ON c.id = cwd.crewId LEFT JOIN secure_workOrder sw ON sw.id = c.workOrderId WHERE cwd.date IS NOT NULL AND sw.isInternal = 0 GROUP BY se.id, cwd.date;

name: Payroll Test 1
prompt:
create a report that will contains all WorkTimes  per user and date of the work times, so group all user work times per date, then show column for Regular Time, for OverTime and Double Time, but the data in those columns needs to be calculated the following way, sum all work time hours for the day and:
- all hours, with a date on a Sunday, will be Double Time 
- all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, under or equal 8 hours would be Regular Time
- all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, over 8 hours would be OverTime
query: SELECT su.firstName AS userFirstName, su.lastName AS userLastName, t.work_date AS workDate, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(t.work_date) = 1 THEN 0 ELSE LEAST(t.total_hours, 8) END AS RegularTime, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(t.work_date) = 1 THEN 0 ELSE GREATEST(t.total_hours - 8, 0) END AS OverTime, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(t.work_date) = 1 THEN t.total_hours ELSE 0 END AS DoubleTime FROM (SELECT wt.employeeId, DATE(COALESCE(wt.startTime, wt.endTime)) AS work_date, SUM(wt.hours) AS total_hours FROM workTime wt JOIN secure_employee e ON e.id = wt.employeeId WHERE e.isInternal = 0 GROUP BY wt.employeeId, DATE(COALESCE(wt.startTime, wt.endTime))) t JOIN secure_user su ON su.employeeId = t.employeeId ORDER BY su.lastName, su.firstName, t.work_date;

name: Settings
prompt: list all settings and the related information
query: select s.name as settingName, s.status, s.valueType, s.value as settingValue, s.valueOptions, s.description, s.statusOnly, s.valueOnly, s.valuePlaceholder, s.valueReadOnly, s.statusChangeFunction, s.isInternal, s.feature, s.sendOnAppLogin, p.name as packageName, concat(su.firstName, ' ', su.lastName) as updatedByName, su.email as updatedByEmail from setting s left join package p on p.id = s.packageId left join secure_user su on su.id = s.updatedBy;

name: Work Orders and Leads
prompt: List all work orders and their leads
query:
SELECT  wo.workOrderNumber AS workOrderNumber,
        wo.description     AS description,
        e.firstName        AS firstName,
        e.lastName         AS lastName,
        e.email            AS email,
        e.phone            AS phone,
wo.id AS workOrderId
FROM    secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN crew        c  ON c.workOrderId = wo.id
LEFT JOIN employeeCrew ec ON ec.crewId = c.id AND ec.isLead = 1
LEFT JOIN secure_employee e ON e.id = ec.employeeId AND e.isInternal = 0
WHERE   wo.isInternal = 0;

name: List all WO
prompt: List all WO
query:
SELECT  wo.workOrderNumber,
        wo.description,
        wo.startDate,
        wo.endDate,
        JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(wo.dynamicAttributes, '$.customAttribute')) AS customAttribute,
        JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(wo.dynamicAttributes, '$.Validity'))        AS Validity,
        JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(wo.dynamicAttributes, '$.EC100'))           AS EC100,
        wos.name AS status,
        c.customerName AS customerName,
wo.id as workOrderId
FROM    secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN workOrderStatus   wos ON wo.workOrderStatusId = wos.id
LEFT JOIN secure_customer   c   ON wo.customerId        = c.id
WHERE   wo.isInternal = FALSE;

name: All inspections
prompt: All inpsections, status, date, work order, asset
query:
SELECT  inspection.date,
        inspection.status,
        wo.workOrderNumber,
        wo.id as workOrderId,
        equipmentOption.name AS asset
FROM    inspection
LEFT JOIN inspectionTemplateWorkOrder itwo ON inspection.inspectionTemplateWorkOrderId = itwo.id
LEFT JOIN secure_workOrder wo             ON itwo.workOrderId = wo.id
LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay ON inspection.crewWorkDayId = crewWorkDay.id
LEFT JOIN equipment   ON crewWorkDay.id = equipment.crewWorkDayId
LEFT JOIN equipmentOption ON equipment.equipmentOptionId = equipmentOption.id;

name: SL False Information
prompt: List Service Locations

name: [TEST] Unexpected error
prompt: Bring lots of numbers
query: SELECT w.workOrderNumber FROM secure_workOrder w WHERE w.isInternal = false;

name: [TEST] Number values
prompt: List currency dynamic attributes and their values
query: SELECT da.`key` AS attribute,dav.`value` AS value FROM dynamicAttribute da JOIN dynamicAttributeValue dav ON da.id=dav.dynamicAttributeId WHERE da.type='CURRENCY';

name: All services
query: SELECT service.date, service.status, wo.workOrderNumber, wo.id as workOrderId, equipmentOption.name AS asset FROM service LEFT JOIN serviceTemplateWorkOrder itwo ON service.serviceTemplateWorkOrderId = itwo.id LEFT JOIN secure_workOrder wo ON itwo.workOrderId = wo.id LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay ON service.crewWorkDayId = crewWorkDay.id LEFT JOIN equipment ON crewWorkDay.id = equipment.crewWorkDayId LEFT JOIN equipmentOption ON equipment.equipmentOptionId = equipmentOption.id;

name: SR with dates
prompt: Work order, leads and start date
query: SELECT w.workOrderNumber, w.startDate, CONCAT(e.firstName,' ',e.lastName) AS leadName FROM secure_workOrder w JOIN crew c ON c.workOrderId=w.id JOIN employeeCrew ec ON ec.crewId=c.id AND ec.isLead=1 JOIN secure_employee e ON e.id=ec.employeeId WHERE w.isInternal=0 AND e.isInternal=0;

name: Anything
prompt: Anything
query:
SELECT wo.description,
        wo.startDate,
        wo.endDate,
        c.customerNo,
        c.customerName AS customerName,
        c.address,
        c.city,
        c.state,
        c.zipCode,
        c.countryCode,
        c.phone   AS customerPhone,
        c.email   AS customerEmail
FROM secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN secure_customer c ON wo.customerId = c.id;

name: Template Copy
query: SELECT name, status FROM inspectionTemplate;

name: all work orders
prompt: all work orders
query:
SELECT  wo.workOrderNumber,
        wo.description,
        wo.startDate,
        wo.endDate,
        wos.name        AS status,
        c.customerName  AS customerName,
        cl.shipToName   AS shipToName
FROM    secure_workOrder wo
JOIN    workOrderStatus     wos ON wo.workOrderStatusId = wos.id
JOIN    secure_customer     c   ON wo.customerId        = c.id
LEFT JOIN secure_customerLocation cl ON wo.customerLocationId = cl.id
WHERE   wo.isInternal = 0;

name: Delete Report
prompt: test
query: SELECT 'test';

name: Amount of templ
prompt: How many templates, ordered by name
query: SELECT COUNT(*) as template_count FROM inspectionTemplate ORDER BY name;

name: Duplicated WTTs
query:
SELECT 
    workTimeTypeId, 
    crewWorkDayId, 
    employeeId, 
    COUNT(*) AS count,
    GROUP_CONCAT(id ORDER BY id SEPARATOR ', ') AS workTimeIds
FROM workTime
GROUP BY workTimeTypeId, crewWorkDayId, employeeId
HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

prompt: New Report!
query:
SELECT wo.workOrderNumber,
        wo.description,
        wo.startDate,
        wo.endDate,
        c.customerName  AS customerName,
        cl.shipToName   AS shipToName
FROM secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN secure_customer         c  ON wo.customerId        = c.id
LEFT JOIN secure_customerLocation cl ON wo.customerLocationId = cl.id;

query:
SELECT wo.workOrderNumber,

        c.customerName AS customerName
FROM secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN secure_customer c ON wo.customerId = c.id;

name: WOs with WT
prompt: list the work orders (work order number) that have at least one work time created
query:
SELECT DISTINCT wo.workOrderNumber, wo.id as workOrderId
FROM   secure_workOrder wo
JOIN   crew        ON wo.id = crew.workOrderId
JOIN   crewWorkDay ON crew.id = crewWorkDay.crewId
JOIN   workTime    ON crewWorkDay.id = workTime.crewWorkDayId;

name: Payroll v3
prompt: create a report that will contains all WorkTimes and Travel Times per user and date of the work times, so group all user work times and travel time per date, add a column to show the work order number where those times where added, and for the date display the weekday (for example mm/dd/yyyy ddd), and for the user show name and last name in the same column called Employee Name Then show column for Regular Time, for OverTime and Double Time, but the data in those columns needs to be calculated the following way, sum all time hours for the day and: - all hours, with a date on a Sunday, will be Double Time - all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, under or equal 8 hours would be Regular Time - all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, over 8 hours would be OverTime, and add a new column with the total of hours
query: SELECT TRIM(CONCAT(COALESCE(CONVERT(e.firstName USING utf8mb4),''),' ',COALESCE(CONVERT(e.lastName USING utf8mb4),''))) AS `Employee Name`, DATE_FORMAT(te.date, '%m/%d/%Y %a') AS `Date`, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT te.workOrderNumber ORDER BY te.workOrderNumber SEPARATOR ', ') AS `Work Order Number`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(te.date)=1 THEN 0 ELSE LEAST(SUM(te.hours),8) END AS `Regular Time`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(te.date)=1 THEN 0 ELSE GREATEST(SUM(te.hours)-8,0) END AS `OverTime`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(te.date)=1 THEN SUM(te.hours) ELSE 0 END AS `Double Time`, SUM(te.hours) AS `Total Hours` FROM ( SELECT wt.employeeId, cwd.date, w.workOrderNumber, wt.hours FROM workTime wt LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON wt.crewWorkDayId = cwd.id LEFT JOIN crew c ON cwd.crewId = c.id JOIN secure_workOrder w ON c.workOrderId = w.id AND w.isInternal = 0 JOIN secure_employee e1 ON e1.id = wt.employeeId AND e1.isInternal = 0 WHERE wt.hours IS NOT NULL UNION ALL SELECT tt.employeeId, cwd.date, w.workOrderNumber, tt.hours FROM travelTime tt LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON tt.crewWorkDayId = cwd.id LEFT JOIN crew c ON cwd.crewId = c.id JOIN secure_workOrder w ON c.workOrderId = w.id AND w.isInternal = 0 JOIN secure_employee e2 ON e2.id = tt.employeeId AND e2.isInternal = 0 WHERE tt.hours IS NOT NULL ) te JOIN secure_employee e ON e.id = te.employeeId AND e.isInternal = 0 WHERE te.date IS NOT NULL GROUP BY te.employeeId, te.date ORDER BY CONVERT(e.lastName USING utf8mb4), CONVERT(e.firstName USING utf8mb4), te.date;

name: Null?
prompt: Return a list of work orders, all returned data associated must be null
query:
SELECT NULL AS workOrderNumber,
       NULL AS description,
       NULL AS startDate,
       NULL AS endDate,
       NULL AS `CURRENCY ATTRIBUTE TEST 1`,
       NULL AS `TEXT ATTRIBUTE TEST`,
       NULL AS `NUMBER ATTRIBUTE TEST`
FROM   secure_workOrder
WHERE  isInternal = FALSE;

prompt: All customers
query:
SELECT  customerName AS customerName,
        address,
        city,
        state,
        zipCode,
        countryCode,
        phone,
        faxNo,
        email
FROM    secure_customer;

name: Dubious result2
description: Missing asset name and... run count?
prompt: Create a report including inspections and a count of how many times it has been run. Join Template and Asset name when appropiate
query:
SELECT i.id   AS inspection_id,
        i.date,
        it.name AS template_name,
        COUNT(i.id) AS run_count
FROM inspection i
LEFT JOIN inspectionTemplateWorkOrder itwo ON i.inspectionTemplateWorkOrderId = itwo.id
LEFT JOIN inspectionTemplate it           ON itwo.inspectionTemplateId = it.id
GROUP BY i.id, i.date, it.name;

name: User activity
prompt: necesito una lista de todos los usuarios mostrnado name, email, y last activity
query:
SELECT  CONCAT(u.firstName, ' ', u.lastName) AS name,
        u.email                                AS email,
        u.lastActivity
FROM    secure_user u
ORDER BY name;

name: DynAttr
prompt: List all assets including dynamic attributes
query: SELECT asset.name, asset.modelNumber, asset.serialNumber, asset.manufacturer, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Cores"')) AS Cores, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Certification"')) AS Certification, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Wattage"')) AS Wattage, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Memory"')) AS Memory, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Clock Speed"')) AS `Clock Speed`, assetType.name AS assetType FROM asset LEFT JOIN assetType ON asset.assetTypeId = assetType.id;

[ T E S T]  Optional  Text

name: Two Date Columns
prompt: Start date, end date
query: SELECT w.startDate AS `Start date`, w.endDate AS `End date`, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(w.dynamicAttributes,'$."[TEST] Optional Currency"')) AS `[TEST] Optional Currency`, JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(w.dynamicAttributes,'$."[TEST] Optional Text"')) AS `[TEST] Optional Text` FROM secure_workOrder w WHERE w.isInternal = false;

name: Crew List
prompt: List All Crew History, even hidden one
query: SELECT e.firstName,e.lastName,er.name AS role,ec.isLead,ec.startDate,ec.endDate,wo.workOrderNumber FROM employeeCrew ec JOIN crew c ON ec.crewId=c.id JOIN secure_workOrder wo ON c.workOrderId=wo.id JOIN secure_employee e ON ec.employeeId=e.id LEFT JOIN employeeRole er ON ec.employeeRoleId=er.id WHERE e.isInternal=0 AND wo.isInternal=0;

        city,
        state,
        zipCode,
        countryCode,
        phone,
        faxNo,
        email
FROM    secure_customer
WHERE   isActive = 1;

name: Dubious results
prompt: Inspections with their date, asset name, template name and all relevant information including status
query:
SELECT inspection.date,
        inspection.status,
        inspectionTemplate.name AS template_name,
        wo.description          AS asset_name,
        inspection.completedAt
FROM inspection
LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay ON inspection.crewWorkDayId = crewWorkDay.id
LEFT JOIN crew        ON crewWorkDay.crewId = crew.id
LEFT JOIN secure_workOrder wo ON crew.workOrderId = wo.id
LEFT JOIN inspectionTemplateWorkOrder ON inspection.inspectionTemplateWorkOrderId = inspectionTemplateWorkOrder.id
LEFT JOIN inspectionTemplate ON inspectionTemplateWorkOrder.inspectionTemplateId = inspectionTemplate.id;

columns.label: C U R R E N C Y  A T T R I B U T E  T E S T 1
T E X T  A T T R I B U T E  T E S T
N U M B E R  A T T R I B U T E  T E S T

name: Internal
prompt: template details
query:
SELECT  wo.workOrderNumber AS WorkOrderNumber,
        wo.description     AS Description,
        wo.startDate       AS StartDate,
        wo.endDate         AS EndDate,
        wos.name           AS Status,
        JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(wo.dynamicAttributes, '$."CURRENCY ATTRIBUTE TEST 1"')) AS "CURRENCY ATTRIBUTE TEST 1",
        JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(wo.dynamicAttributes, '$."TEXT ATTRIBUTE TEST"'))       AS "TEXT ATTRIBUTE TEST",
        JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(wo.dynamicAttributes, '$."NUMBER ATTRIBUTE TEST"'))     AS "NUMBER ATTRIBUTE TEST"
FROM    secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN workOrderStatus wos ON wo.workOrderStatusId = wos.id
WHERE   wo.isInternal = FALSE;

name: Employee Utilization
description: Utilization metrics by employee for weekdays/weekends and worked days within a period.
query: WITH RECURSIVE period_bounds AS (SELECT COALESCE(CAST(@startDate AS DATE), MIN(workDate)) AS periodStart, COALESCE(CAST(@endDate AS DATE), MAX(workDate)) AS periodEnd, LEAST(COALESCE(CAST(@endDate AS DATE), MAX(workDate)), DATE_ADD(COALESCE(CAST(@startDate AS DATE), MIN(workDate)), INTERVAL 365 DAY)) AS periodEndCapped FROM (SELECT cwd.date AS workDate FROM workTime wt INNER JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id = wt.crewWorkDayId UNION ALL SELECT cwd.date AS workDate FROM travelTime tt INNER JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id = tt.crewWorkDayId) all_dates), calendar AS (SELECT periodStart AS periodDate FROM period_bounds WHERE periodStart IS NOT NULL AND periodEndCapped IS NOT NULL UNION ALL SELECT DATE_ADD(periodDate, INTERVAL 1 DAY) FROM calendar JOIN period_bounds ON 1=1 WHERE periodDate < periodEndCapped), employee_days AS (SELECT employeeId, workDate FROM (SELECT wt.employeeId AS employeeId, cwd.date AS workDate FROM workTime wt INNER JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id = wt.crewWorkDayId UNION ALL SELECT tt.employeeId AS employeeId, cwd.date AS workDate FROM travelTime tt INNER JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id = tt.crewWorkDayId) raw_days JOIN period_bounds pb ON raw_days.workDate BETWEEN pb.periodStart AND pb.periodEndCapped GROUP BY employeeId, workDate), employee_summary AS (SELECT employeeId, COUNT(*) AS totalDaysWorked, SUM(CASE WHEN WEEKDAY(workDate) < 5 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS totalWeekdaysWorked, SUM(CASE WHEN WEEKDAY(workDate) >= 5 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS totalWeekendWorked FROM employee_days GROUP BY employeeId), period_totals AS (SELECT COUNT(*) AS totalDaysInPeriod, SUM(CASE WHEN WEEKDAY(periodDate) < 5 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS totalWeekdaysInPeriod, SUM(CASE WHEN WEEKDAY(periodDate) >= 5 THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) AS totalWeekendDaysInPeriod FROM calendar) SELECT e.id AS employeeId, CONCAT(e.firstName, ' ', e.lastName) AS employee, COALESCE(pt.totalWeekdaysInPeriod, 0) AS totalWeekdaysInPeriod, COALESCE(pt.totalWeekendDaysInPeriod, 0) AS totalWeekendDaysInPeriod, COALESCE(es.totalWeekdaysWorked, 0) AS totalWeekdaysWithWorkOrTravelTime, COALESCE(es.totalWeekendWorked, 0) AS totalWeekendDaysWithWorkOrTravelTime, CASE WHEN COALESCE(pt.totalDaysInPeriod, 0) = 0 THEN 0 ELSE ROUND((COALESCE(es.totalDaysWorked, 0) / pt.totalDaysInPeriod) * 100, 2) END AS percentUtilized, pb.periodStart AS period FROM secure_employee e CROSS JOIN period_bounds pb LEFT JOIN employee_summary es ON es.employeeId = e.id LEFT JOIN period_totals pt ON 1=1 WHERE e.isInternal = false AND e.isActive = true ORDER BY employee;

name: Payroll LR Report
prompt: create a report that will contains all WorkTimes per user and date of the work times, so group all user work times per date, add a column to show the work order number where those Times where added, the location using only the abbreviation of first letters, the role using abbreviation of first letters, and for the date display the weekday (for example mm/dd/yyyy ddd), and for the user show name and last name in the same column called Employee Name Then show column for Regular Time, for OverTime and Double Time, but the data in those columns needs to be calculated the following way, sum all work time hours for the day and: - all hours, with a date on a Sunday, will be Double Time - all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, under or equal 8 hours would be Regular Time - all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, over 8 hours would be OverTime, and add a new column with the total of hours
query: SELECT TRIM(CONCAT(COALESCE(se.firstName,''),' ',COALESCE(se.lastName,''))) AS `Employee Name`, cwd.date AS `Date`, swo.workOrderNumber AS `Work Order Number`, CASE WHEN sl.name IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE CONCAT(LEFT(TRIM(sl.name),1),IF(TRIM(sl.name) LIKE '% %',LEFT(SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(TRIM(sl.name),' ',2),' ',-1),1),''),IF(TRIM(sl.name) LIKE '% % %',LEFT(SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(TRIM(sl.name),' ',3),' ',-1),1),''),IF(TRIM(sl.name) LIKE '% % % %',LEFT(SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(TRIM(sl.name),' ',4),' ',-1),1),'')) END AS `Location`, CASE WHEN er.name IS NULL THEN NULL ELSE CONCAT(LEFT(TRIM(er.name),1),IF(TRIM(er.name) LIKE '% %',LEFT(SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(TRIM(er.name),' ',2),' ',-1),1),''),IF(TRIM(er.name) LIKE '% % %',LEFT(SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(TRIM(er.name),' ',3),' ',-1),1),''),IF(TRIM(er.name) LIKE '% % % %',LEFT(SUBSTRING_INDEX(SUBSTRING_INDEX(TRIM(er.name),' ',4),' ',-1),1),'')) END AS `Role`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date)=1 THEN 0 ELSE LEAST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours,0)),8) END AS `Regular Time`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date)=1 THEN 0 ELSE GREATEST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours,0))-8,0) END AS `OverTime`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date)=1 THEN SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours,0)) ELSE 0 END AS `Double Time`, SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours,0)) AS `Total Hours` FROM workTime wt JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id=wt.crewWorkDayId JOIN crew c ON c.id=cwd.crewId JOIN secure_workOrder swo ON swo.id=c.workOrderId AND swo.isInternal=0 JOIN secure_employee se ON se.id=wt.employeeId AND se.isInternal=0 LEFT JOIN serviceLocation sl ON sl.id=swo.serviceLocationId LEFT JOIN employeeRole er ON er.id=se.employeeRoleId GROUP BY se.id,cwd.date,swo.id,swo.workOrderNumber,sl.name,er.name;

name: Payroll v2
description: show payroll using basic payroll rules and show total hours
prompt: create a report that will contains all WorkTimes per user and date of the work times, so group all user work times per date, add a column to show the work order number where those Times where added, and for the date display the weekday (for example mm/dd/yyyy ddd), and for the user show name and last name in the same column called Employee Name Then show column for Regular Time, for OverTime and Double Time, but the data in those columns needs to be calculated the following way, sum all work time hours for the day and: - all hours, with a date on a Sunday, will be Double Time - all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, under or equal 8 hours would be Regular Time - all hours, with a date that is a weekday or Saturday, over 8 hours would be OverTime, and add a new column with the total of hours
query: SELECT TRIM(CONCAT(COALESCE(CONVERT(se.firstName USING utf8mb4), ''), ' ', COALESCE(CONVERT(se.lastName USING utf8mb4), ''))) AS `Employee Name`, cwd.date AS `Date`, GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT swo.workOrderNumber ORDER BY swo.workOrderNumber SEPARATOR ', ') AS `Work Order Number`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN 0 ELSE LEAST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)), 8) END AS `Regular Time`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN 0 ELSE GREATEST(SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) - 8, 0) END AS `OverTime`, CASE WHEN DAYOFWEEK(cwd.date) = 1 THEN SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) ELSE 0 END AS `Double Time`, SUM(COALESCE(wt.hours, 0)) AS `Total Hours` FROM workTime wt JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON cwd.id = wt.crewWorkDayId JOIN crew c ON c.id = cwd.crewId JOIN secure_workOrder swo ON swo.id = c.workOrderId AND swo.isInternal = 0 JOIN secure_employee se ON se.id = wt.employeeId AND se.isInternal = 0 GROUP BY se.id, TRIM(CONCAT(COALESCE(CONVERT(se.firstName USING utf8mb4), ''), ' ', COALESCE(CONVERT(se.lastName USING utf8mb4), ''))), cwd.date;

name: Evil Tobi
prompt: evil tobi
query:
SELECT e.firstName  AS FirstName,
        e.lastName   AS LastName,
        e.email      AS Email,
        e.phone      AS Phone
FROM secure_workOrder wo
LEFT JOIN crew         ON wo.id = crew.workOrderId
LEFT JOIN employeeCrew ON crew.id = employeeCrew.crewId
LEFT JOIN secure_employee e ON employeeCrew.employeeId = e.id
WHERE e.isInternal = FALSE
  AND (e.firstName LIKE '%evil%' OR e.lastName LIKE '%tobi%');

name: All work times
prompt: All work times
query:
SELECT workTime.hours,
        workTime.startTime,
        workTime.endTime,
        workTimeType.name AS workTimeTypeName,
        e.firstName       AS employeeFirstName,
        e.lastName        AS employeeLastName,
        e.email           AS employeeEmail,
        e.phone           AS employeePhone
FROM workTime
LEFT JOIN workTimeType   ON workTime.workTimeTypeId = workTimeType.id
LEFT JOIN secure_employee e ON workTime.employeeId = e.id;

name: All DA columns
prompt: show me all assets and a column for each dynamic attribute
query: SELECT asset.name AS name,asset.modelNumber AS modelNumber,asset.serialNumber AS serialNumber,asset.manufacturer AS manufacturer,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."UD"')) AS UD,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."customAttribute"')) AS customAttribute,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."HP"')) AS HP,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Cores"')) AS Cores,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Certification"')) AS Certification,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Wattage"')) AS Wattage,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Not req"')) AS `Not req`,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Type 2"')) AS `Type 2`,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Punish List Item"')) AS `Punish List Item`,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Type 1"')) AS `Type 1`,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Priority"')) AS Priority,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Memory"')) AS Memory,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."EC100"')) AS EC100,JSON_UNQUOTE(JSON_EXTRACT(asset.dynamicAttributes,'$."Clock Speed"')) AS `Clock Speed` FROM asset;

name: Work order with time
prompt: List all the work orders that have at least one work time added
query: SELECT DISTINCT wo.workOrderNumber, wo.description, wo.id as workOrderId FROM secure_workOrder wo WHERE wo.isInternal = 0 AND EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM workTime wt JOIN crewWorkDay cwd ON wt.crewWorkDayId = cwd.id JOIN crew c ON cwd.crewId = c.id WHERE c.workOrderId = wo.id);

name: CREW-841
prompt: Description

name: WOs inspections
prompt: All inspections
query:
SELECT inspection.date,
        inspection.status
FROM inspection
LEFT JOIN crewWorkDay ON inspection.crewWorkDayId = crewWorkDay.id
LEFT JOIN crew        ON crewWorkDay.crewId = crew.id;
